etymology.description: Depicts 心(心) (xīn, "heart") with 大 dot (hole) -> intelligence
etymology.interpretation: The character originally represented intelligence through the depiction of a hole on the heart, reflecting a traditional concept of intelligence. Over time, its meaning shifted towards quickness or haste, which is retained in its association with 聰(聰) (cōng, "intelligent").

examples.chinese: 他悤聪颖(他悤聰穎)，总能化解危机(總能化解危機)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cōng cōngyǐng, zǒng néng huàjiě wēijī.
examples.english: He is clever and always able to solve crises.

examples.chinese: 学者以悤机应变(學者以悤機應變)，成就非凡(成就非凡)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yǐ cōng jī yìngbiàn, chéngjiù fēifán.
examples.english: Scholars use their clever wit to adapt, achieving extraordinary success.
